de.happybavarian07.coolstufflib.languagemanager

Class LanguageConfig

  • java.lang.Object

  • public class LanguageConfig
extends Object

    • Constructor Detail

      • LanguageConfig

        public LanguageConfig(File langFile,
                      File langFolder,
                      String resourceDirectory,
                      String langName,
                      org.bukkit.plugin.java.JavaPlugin plugin)
        The LanguageConfig function is used to create a new LanguageConfig object. This function will also save the default language file if it does not exist, and load the configuration from that file into memory.
        Parameters:
        langFile - Set the file variable
        langFolder - Create the folder where the language file is stored
        resourceDirectory - Specify the folder in which the language file is located
        langName - Set the name of the language file
        plugin - Get the plugin name, which is used to save the default config
        See Also:
        LanguageManager

    • Method Detail

      • reloadConfig

        public void reloadConfig()
        The reloadConfig function reloads the config file from disk. It is called when the plugin is enabled, and whenever a player uses /reload.

      • getConfig

        public org.bukkit.configuration.file.FileConfiguration getConfig()
        The getConfig function is used to get the configuration file for this plugin. If the config file does not exist, it will be created.
        Returns:
        The config file

      • saveConfig

        public void saveConfig()
        The saveConfig function saves the config file to disk.

      • saveDefaultConfig

        public void saveDefaultConfig()
        The saveDefaultConfig function is used to save the default configuration file from the plugin's jar. This function will only run if there is no existing config file in the plugins data folder.

      • getLangName

        public String getLangName()
        The getLangName function returns the name of the language.
        Returns:
        The name of the language

      • getFile

        public File getFile()
        The getFile function returns the file that is being read from.
        Returns:
        A file object
